abstract: Students solve two problems involving the motion of projectile objects, modeling the motion using quadratic equations. PLEASE NOTE: This activity can be assigned, but student responses will not be saved.
description:
Students solve two problems involving the motion of projectile objects, modeled using quadratic equations. Students graph parabolas and use the graphs to answer questions about projectile objects. Students identify the maximum heights of the moving objects and discover how long each object is in the air before hitting the ground. Quadratic Word Problems Part 1 is the second of four activities for teaching and learning quadratic equations in algebra: Graphing Quadratic Equations; Quadratic Word Problems Part 1; Quadratic Word Problems Part 2; and Quadratic Functions in Vertex Form.

Â» Lesson Plan and Student Assessment documents are also available.

PLEASE NOTE: This activity can be assigned, but student responses will not be saved.
name: Quadratic Word Problems Part 1
